feed.title: NewsTracker: ukraine
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: 9 dead as shelling increases in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary: A night-long artillery exchange in eastern Ukraine between government troops and Russia-backed rebels claimed nine lives on Monday, casting doubt on the already shaky cease-fire.

entry.title: 9 dead as shelling increases in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary:
A woman visit her apartment damaged after shelling in Mariupol, Ukraine, Monday, Aug. 17, 2015.

The shelling on Monday came after failed talks between Ukraine, the rebels and the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe which were supposed to agree on further steps to withdraw weaponry.

entry.title: 9 dead as shelling increases in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary: At least seven civilians and two Ukrainian troops were killed overnight today in eastern Ukraine as shelling from the warring sides intensified.

entry.title: 9 dead as shelling increases in eastern Ukraine
Civilians killed as fighting flares in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary:
Fighting flared between Ukrainian government forces and Russian-backed separatists in two separate parts of eastern Ukraine overnight with several civilians killed by shelling, Ukrainian police and separatist sources said on Monday.

It has also drawn expressions of concern among Western governments, who see a ceasefire and tentative peace agreement worked out in Minsk, Belarus, as still the best chance of ending the separatist rebellion in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Cease-fire violations in eastern Ukraine discussed by Russian, German foreign ministers
entry.summary: MOSCOW - Russia and Germany both expressed concern Friday about violations of the cease-fire in eastern Ukraine and the risk of a new escalation of the conflict.

entry.title: US: alleged insider trading ring relied on hackers from Ukraine
Missile fragments possibly found at MH17 crash site
entry.summary:
THE HAGUE, Netherlands -- Dutch prosecutors said Tuesday they have found what they believe could be parts of a Buk missile system at the site in eastern Ukraine where Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was brought down last year.

Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was heading from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur when it was brought down over conflict-torn Ukraine.

entry.title: Flight MH17: possible parts of missile system found at Ukraine crash site
US warns of sharp rise in separatist attacks in Ukraine
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - The United States says Ukrainian rebels launched more attacks over the last three days than any similar time period since February, in what may be an escalating effort by Russian-backed militants to destabilize Ukraine's Western-backed government.

entry.title: US warns of sharp rise in separatist attacks in Ukraine
entry.summary:
State Department spokesman John Kirby says the attacks include a heavy artillery assault on a southeastern Ukraine town.

Kirby says since Saturday, three soldiers have been killed and 35 wounded in 127 distinct separatist attacks reported by Ukraine.

He also expressed concern about an arson attack in eastern Ukraine on four armored cars operated by a European observer mission.

entry.title: Ukraine bans films featuring blacklisted Russian actors
entry.summary: Ukraine says it has banned the screening of films featuring Russian actors included on a blacklist.

entry.title: Ukraine's ex-PM sets up 'Ukraine salvation committee'
entry.summary: MOSCOW (AP) " Ukraine's former prime minister, in exile in Moscow, has announced the creation of a 'Ukraine salvation committee' and pushed for early presidential and parliamentary elections.

entry.title: U.S. Imposes Further Russia And Ukraine-Related Sanctions
entry.summary: The United States has imposed further Russia and Ukraine-related sanctions, including on Crimean port operators, former Ukrainian officials, and a former Russian gas trader.

entry.title: Reports: Ukraine bans Depardieu for 5 years
entry.summary:
Local news reports say Ukraine has banned actor Gerard Depardieu from entering the country for five years.

The news website Apostrof on Tuesday published what it said was a letter from Ukraine's national security service, the SBU, saying Depardieu has been banned "in the interest of ensuring the security of our state."

entry.title: Ukraine says Russian officer detained when truckload of weapons intercepted
Ukraine claims Russian officer detained
entry.summary:
MOSCOW (AP) - Ukraine's border guards service says it has detained a Russian officer who was driving a truck packed with weapons including rocket-propelled grenades.

Ukraine and Western countries contend Russia is providing troops and weaponry to eastern Ukraine's rebels, who have been fighting Ukrainian forces since April 2014 in a war that has killed at least 6,400 people.

entry.title: U.S. To Start Training Ukrainian Army Troops This Fall
entry.summary: "This training is part of our long-running defense cooperation with Ukraine."

entry.title: U.S. To Train Ukraine Military Following Russian Agression
entry.summary: Toner said he had nothing to announce on any new weapons for Ukraine and that the focus was on providing non-lethal aid.

entry.title: US to expand Ukraine military training
entry.summary: The White House said Biden and Poroshenko also talked about Ukraine's efforts to combat corruption and the urgency of seeking justice in the crash of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17, which was shot down over Ukraine just over a year ago.

entry.title: US to expand Ukraine military training
entry.summary: Spokesman Mark Toner said the new program would increase to more than $244 million the amount of U.S. security assistance provided to Ukraine since last year when conflict between Kiev and Russian-backed separatists escalated in the east of the country.

entry.title: US to expand Ukraine military training
entry.summary: The State Department announced that the training would begin this fall in western Ukraine.

entry.title: Ukraine's new police on charm offensive in Kiev
entry.summary: In this photo taken, Wednesday, July 15, 2015, a couple takes a photograph with a Ukrainian police officer in downtown Kiev, Ukraine.

entry.title: Ukraine replaces entire police force to beat corruption
entry.summary: Just as in neighboring Russia, Ukraine's police corps was perceived as chronically extorting bribes and harassing citizens.

entry.title: Ukraine's new police on charm offensive in Kiev
entry.summary:
KIEV, Ukraine - Only a few months ago, Kiev residents would normally avoid the police if they could help it.

One of the pledges of the new Kiev government, which took over last year after pro-Russian President Viktor Yanukovych fled the country, was to combat rampant corruption in Ukraine's police.

entry.title: Cars of OSCE observers vandalized in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary: A demonstrator uses spray-paint to deface the windshield of a car of the OSCE and the International Committee of the Red Cross during a protest in Donetsk, eastern Ukraine, Thursday, July 23, 2015.

entry.title: Cars of OSCE observers vandalized in eastern Ukraine
Ukraine's justice ministry bars Communists from running in upcoming local elections
entry.summary:
KIEV, Ukraine - Ukraine's justice ministry has barred three Communist parties from running in the upcoming local elections, citing recent legislation.

The Communist party has been an important force in Ukraine, polling 13 percent in the 2012 parliamentary election, but its popularity plummeted over its support for ex-President Viktor Yunukovych.

In last year's parliamentary election the Communist Party of Ukraine garnered less than 4 percent of the vote.

Ukraine passed several laws in April banning the use of symbols from the Soviet years and denouncing Communist ideology.

entry.title: Volunteer named governor in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary: Since hostilities broke out in eastern Ukraine in April 2014, killing more than 6,400 people, the Ukrainian government has controlled only parts of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

entry.title: Ukraine rebels say their small weapons pullback is beginning
Ukrainian rebels claim to be pulling back smaller weapons from front line in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary:
MOSCOW - Ukraine's separatist rebels say they have begun pulling back military vehicles with small-caliber weapons from most of the front line in their war with Ukrainian forces.

The rebels said tanks and armored vehicles with weapons under 100mm would be pulled back three kilometers (two miles) from most of front line in eastern Ukraine.
